Murat Karslioglu is a serial entrepreneur, technologist, and startup advisor with over 15 years of experience in storage, distributed systems, and enterprise hardware development.
Prior to joining MayaData as VP of Product, Murat worked at Hewlett Packard Enterprise / 3PAR Storage in various advanced development projects including storage file stack performance optimization and the storage management stack for HPEâ€™s Hyper-converged solution. Before joining HPE, Murat led virtualization and OpenStack integration projects within the Nexenta CTO Office.
Murat holds a Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Industrial Engineering from the Sakarya University, Turkey, as well as a number of IT certifications. When he is not in his lab, he loves to travel, advise startups, and spend time with his family.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam

venue.name: Kolektif House Levent
venue.address_1: Esentepe

events.description:
Herkese Merhabalar,

2 Mart cumartesi gÃ¼nÃ¼ saat 09:00 da Levent Kolektif House Workup alanÄ±nda Cloud Study Jam yani bir workshop ile buluÅŸacaÄŸÄ±z.
Sadece 50 kiÅŸilik yerimiz var.

KonuÅŸacagÄ±mÄ±z ve uygulayacaÄŸÄ±mÄ±z konular:
- Kubernetes in the Google Cloud
- Introduction to Docker
- Hello Node Kubernetes
- Build a Slack Bot with Node.js on Kubernetes

Kubernetes in the Google Cloud
Kubernetes is the most popular container orchestration system and it was designed specifically with Google Cloud Platform integration in mind. In this advanced-level quest, you will get hands-on practice configuring Docker images and containers, deploying fully-fledged Kubernetes Engine applications, and integrating Slackbot and MongoDB databases with Kubernetes. This quest will teach you the practical skills needed for integrating container orchestration into your own workflow.

Introduction to Docker
In this lab you will familiarize yourself with the basic Docker container environment commands. You will create, run, and debug containers, and learn to pull and push images to and from Google Container Registry.

Hello Node Kubernetes
In this hands-on lab, you turn your code into a replicated application running on Kubernetes. You create a Node.js app, create a Docker container from it, deploy it to Kubernetes Engine, and scale it up. Watch a short preview Hello Node Kubernetes, GCP Essentials.

Build a Slack Bot with Node.js on Kubernetes
In this lab you'll learn how to build and run a Slack Bot with Google Cloud Platform uses Kubernetes Engine, a hosted version of Kubernetes. Watch the short video Build a Slack Bot with Node.js on Kubernetes

Selamlar,

17:00 - 17:50 -> GÃ¼ray YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m - CI/CD'nin Ã–tesi: Continuous Development ve GKE

HÃ¼seyin Babal - Private Kubernetes Clusters, The Right Way

Abstract: In this session, there will be tips & tricks about how to automate Private Kubernetes cluster installation and configuration by using Terraform on GCP. There will be sample configurations explained during the session, and also will show you how to expose services to the public internet in a secure way.

About Author: Building Hazelcast Cloud to provide Hazelcast Cluster as a service with extensive features. AWS Certified DevOps Professional. Building highly scalable, real-time systems with Spring Boot, Kubernetes, Docker, Prometheus, Event-Based Systems, and Hybrid Cloud. Ex. Sony and eBay engineer

------------------------------------

Metin Seylan - Tricks for High Performance Services on Kubernetes

Abstract:
Daha Ã¶nce hep Kubernetes nasÄ±l Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±r nasÄ±l deployment yapÄ±lÄ±r onlar konuÅŸuldu, ancak Microservice dÃ¼nyasÄ±nda Kubernetes tÃ¼m problemleri Ã§Ã¶zen sihirli bir tool deÄŸil.

Kod seviyesinde yapÄ±lan deÄŸiÅŸikliklerin infra tarafÄ±nda her zaman bir karÅŸÄ±lÄ±ÄŸÄ± var

Boot SÃ¼relerini HÄ±zlandÄ±rmak
Dependency Injection nasÄ±l Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±r

Problemin Ã§Ã¶zÃ¼mÃ¼ iÃ§in Compile Time Injection ve Framework ile beraberinde gelen Ã§Ã¶zÃ¼mler

Kubernetes tarafÄ±nda gRPC kullanÄ±rken dikkat edilmesi gerekenler ve kazanÄ±mlarÄ±

About Author: He is a Senior Software Developer, Open Source contributor and a Google Developer Expert on Cloud. Currently working at Scotty Turkey and mainly focused on the distributed systems and microservices. You can learn more about Metin by following him on Github! (@MetinSeylan)!

------------------------------------

GÃ¼ray YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m - CI/CD'nin Ã–tesi: Continuous Development ve GKE

Abstract:
CI/CD/CDP pipelines have been improving in a serious acceleration. At this speed, developers adopted a number of significant new technologies. Mostly, experience of developers are ignored, or not improved as much as other fields. In order to solve these problems, there are a number of tools that produces the term "continuous development". In this session, we will see why continuous development is a requirement, how it makes developers' life easier, why/how to implement it, and more.

Growing CI/CD technologies
Developer experience and DevOps
Developer experience in container world
Why developers need more? Why it is a problem?
What is continuous development? How it solves the problem?
Continuous development in Kubernetes
Demo

GÃ¼ray, DevOps engineer with special interest in Kubernetes / Docker and other container tech. Working with multi-host deployments with customer oriented infrastructure automation & plugins and CI/CD/CDP pipelines. Libre software lover.

events.name: Google Cloud Days #2 - Google Assistant Workshop [Need PC]

venue.name: Kolektif House Maslak
venue.address_1: Maslak, Ahi Evran Cd. No:6

events.description:
Selamlar,

Yeni yÄ±lÄ±n ikinci etkinliÄŸi ile karÅŸÄ±nÄ±zdayÄ±z, herkese iyi ve mutlu yÄ±llar dileriz.

Program:
13:00 - 17:00 -> YÃ¼ksel Tolun - Google Assistant Workshop

Bio: I'm a full-time lawyer and a hobbyist web and voice app developer from Turkey. I have been developing Actions for Google Assistant for two years while also trying to teach people how they can also develop for the platform. This led me to become a GDE (Google Developers Expert) on the subject and I started to focus more on the community by volunteering for workshops/codelabs and talking at events.

Abstract: This is an introductory session about building voice apps for the Google Assistant.

The voice revolution is already here. We have smart speakers that can answer our questions or fulfill our needs without the need for clicks, taps or presses. Kids pick up smartphones, invoke the digital assistants and immediately give them commands :)

But what does this mean for us developers? How can we develop our own voice apps that can answer our users' needs in a similar fashion? In this session, we'll try to answer these questions by taking a closer look at Actions on Google platform. By the end of it, you'll have developed your first Action

This is a technical session and yet it is beginner-friendly.

------------------------------------

Bizi sosyal medyada takip etmeyi unutmayÄ±n!
